Title: 3. News Media
Write-Up Text: The Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) is undergoing significant changes. The RBA's function of setting interest rates has been replaced by a new monetary policy board providing greater transparency and decision-making diversity. This change aims to ensure the RBA's framework remains relevant in the changing global economy. While experts warn that interest rate pain may not end for borrowers the new reform is expected to support the RBA's key goals of achieving price stability employment and sustainable economic growth.
